Package: sk.hax.software.os

[Groovy] Class NetworkDriver

    • sk.hax.software.os.NetworkDriver
    • All Implemented Interfaces and Traits:
      InboundDeviceListener

      final class NetworkDriver

      Driver for a network interface. Provides a higher level abstraction for the hardware layer and enables network and transport layer addressing (network address and ports). Is used by the kernel to provide a networking API for tasks. Network address 127.0.0.1 is called loopback and is treated specially, so that anything sent to that address and some port is sent to that port on the current machine. Network port 0 is called ping port and is treated specially, so that anything sent to it is returned to the sender.

      Authors:
      mio

      • Constructor Detail

        • NetworkDriver(java.net.NetworkInterface networkInterface)

          Create a network driver for the specified network interface.

          Parameters:

      • Method Detail

        • void closePort(int port)

          Close the port with the specified number. The port becomes available for opening again.

          Parameters:
          port - port number to close

        • java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer, OutboundChannel> getPorts()

          Get a map of all currently open ports.

          Returns:
          map of all open ports along with their channels

        • boolean isPortOpen(int port)

          Check whether the specified port is currently open.

          Parameters:
          port - port number to check
          Returns:
          true if the port is open (assigned to a task), false otherwise

        • Channel openPort(int port)

          Open the port with the specified number. Returns an asynchronous channel for communicating through the port.

          Parameters:
          port - port number to open
          Returns:
          asynchronous channel for communicating through the open port, null if the port is already open

        • SyncChannel openSyncPort(int port)

          Open the port with the specified number. Returns an synchronous channel for communicating through the port.

          Parameters:
          port - port number to open
          Returns:
          synchronous channel for communicating through the open port, null if the port is already open

        • void send(OutboundChannel channel, Datagram datagram)

          Send a datagram out to the network from the specified channel. Is used internally by the channel implementation.

          Parameters:
          channel - source channel of the datagram
          datagram - datagram to send

        • @java.lang.Override void trigger(InboundDevice origin, byte[] data)
